title: Crawler
summary: A web crawler is a program, often called a bot or robot, which systematically browses the Web to collect data from webpages. Typically search engines (e.g. Google, Bing, etc.) use crawlers to build indexes.

parents.title: MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms
